se.dat255.bulletinferno.util
Class PhysicsShapeFactory

java.lang.Object
  se.dat255.bulletinferno.util.PhysicsShapeFactory

public class PhysicsShapeFactory
extends java.lang.Object

Static factory class that creates various complex Box2D shapes with simple method calls.

Method Detail

getRectangularShape

public static com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Shape getRectangularShape(float width,
                                                                       float height)
Creates a rectangle that is of the desired width/height. (For Box2D hackers: this method uses normal width/height, rather than half-width/heights as Box2D usually uses.)

Please note that shapes must be properly disposed of (but the physics system will handle that for you if you have used the shape with the system, e.g. in a PhysicsBodyDefinition).

Parameters:
width - the width of the shape.
height - the height of the shape.
Returns:
a rectangular Box2D shape.

getRectangularShape

public static com.badlogic.gdx.physics.box2d.Shape getRectangularShape(float width,
                                                                       float height,
                                                                       com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 position)
Like getRectangularShape(float, float) but has position. Yep, Box2D shapes have (relative) position, which is usually interpreted as how much off-center they are on a physics body (which in turn depends on other shapes/fixtures on the body).

Parameters:
position - the position relative to center (usually on a physics body).
See Also:
getRectangularShape(float, float)

getChainShape
